page.title: 12Buxton:Road Transport
page.content: Buxton is the meeting place of several major roads and routes.The{A6} passes through the town,and carries traffic from Bakewell,Matlock and further south towards Stockport and Manchester.This road carries a great deal of traffic,including many heavy lorries from neighbouring quarries. Indeed,there has been such pressure on the road through Fairfield that there has been much talk of a bypass.People in Fairfield are worried because of the lack of access to the estates for the emergency services when the road is congested with traffic. Other important routes are those to Congleton,Macclesfield,Leek and the Potteries,and the scenic route over Long Hill to Manchester.Many of the roads leading out of Buxton are attractive to tourists because of the beautiful countryside they cross.
